title: Top app bar
description: Top app bars display information and actions at the top of a screen.

contentChunks.htmlValue: There are four types of top app bars: center-aligned, small, medium, and large.

contentChunks.footer:
1. Center-aligned
2. Small
3. Medium
4. Large

contentChunks.htmlValue: Resources

TypeLinkStatus
DesignDesign kit (Figma)
Available
M2 guideline â€“ Top app barAvailable
ImplementationMDC-AndroidAvailable
Jetpack ComposeAvailable
FlutterAvailable
WebPlanned
Takeaways

• Top app bars provide content and actions related to the current screen
  • Instead of elevating with a drop shadow, top app bars use a color fill to create separation from content
  • The width of the top app bar container is the same as the width of the view or device
What's new

• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color
  • Elevation: No drop shadow, instead a color fill creates separation from content
  • Typography: Larger default text
  • Layout: Larger default height
  • Types: There are now four types of top app bar: center-aligned, small, medium, and large

contentChunks.altText: Top app bar with content below

contentChunks.footer: M2: Bold contrasting colors separate the top app bar from the content beneath.
contentChunks.altText: Purple M2 top app bar

contentChunks.footer: M3: A color fill overlay separates the top app bar from the content beneath.
contentChunks.altText: Subtle lilac-colored top app bar

contentChunks.altText: 4 top app bars with headlines and action icons

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage

Use a top app bar to provide content and actions related to a current screen, such as navigation, screen headlines, and actions.

The information and actions offered are primarily contextual and specific to a screen, but may also include access to key cross-app journeys.

contentChunks.footer: A top app bar provides content and actions related to a current screen.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar with content below

contentChunks.htmlValue:
There are four types of top app bars:

  1. Center aligned
    For the main root page in an app. Used Â to display the app name or page headline.
  2. Small
    For compact layouts or scrolled views on subpages that require back navigation and multiple actions.
  3. Medium
    For the initial state of the small top app bar before scrolling. Used to display a larger headline treatment.
  4. Large
    For an even bigger top app bar. Used to emphasize the headline of the page.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Center aligned 2. Small 3. Medium 4. Large
contentChunks.altText: Diagram of stacked top app bars, from small to large

contentChunks.htmlValue: Anatomy

contentChunks.footer:
1. Container
2. Leading navigation icon
3. Headline
4. Trailing interactive icons
contentChunks.altText: Diagram of app bar layout

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Container

Top app bar containers hold all information and actions at the top of a screen, including navigation icons, headlines, and interactive icons like the overflow menu.

The top app barâ€™s container is full-width and always extends edge-to-edge on a given screen.

contentChunks.footer: Use straight corners for top app bars.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar with square corner

contentChunks.footer: Donâ€™t use curved shapes on top app bars as it implies that the container can expand upon interaction.
contentChunks.altText: Curved shape on top app bar corner

contentChunks.htmlValue: Always use the default height of a top app bar.

contentChunks.footer: Default heights were chosen to ensure legibility of on-screen elements.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar at default height

contentChunks.footer: Don't make a top app bar shorter than its default height by applying density.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar shortened

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Navigation icon

Top app bars contain an optional leading navigation icon. When it appears in an app bar, itâ€™s aligned on the left of the bar.

The navigation icon can take any of the following forms:

  • A menu icon, which opens a navigationÂ 
  • An up arrow, which navigates upward an appâ€™s hierarchy
  • A back arrow, which returns to the previous screen

contentChunks.footer: 1. Navigation icon
contentChunks.altText: Leading navigation icon aligned on left of app bar

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Headline

The top app bar headline can describe:

  • The screen a user is currently on
  • The section the user is currently in
  • The app being used

Headline text should easily fit within the top app bar. It should not be truncated or shrunken.

contentChunks.footer: If headline text is long, use a large top app bar and wrap the headline to two lines.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar headline text set in 2 lines

contentChunks.footer: Donâ€™t wrap text in a small, medium, or center-aligned top app bar.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar headline text in too small setting

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Headlines for small, medium, and large top app bars are aligned to the start edge of the container. Headlines for center aligned top app bars are center aligned.

The headlineâ€™s typography size and style varies depending on the type of top app bar. See the specs tab for precise values.

contentChunks.footer:
1. Center aligned
2. Small
3. Medium
4. Large
contentChunks.altText: Diagram of stacked top app bars with headline sizes, from small to large

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Trailing interactive icons

Up to three interactive icons can be placed after the headline, at the trailing end of the container.

Place most-used actions closest to the leading edge and progress towards the end.

contentChunks.footer: Order action items by putting the most-used action (1) on the far left, second-most-used action (2) to its right, and so on. Any remaining or secondary actions should be placed in an overflow menu (3).
contentChunks.altText: 3 icons placed to right of headline, from most to least used

contentChunks.htmlValue: When there are more than three interactive icons, the less important ones can be collapsed into an overflow menu. The overflow menu then takes the place of a third action.

contentChunks.footer: Use the overflow menu to collapse less important actions.
contentChunks.altText: Overflow menu showing 2 collapsed icons

contentChunks.footer: Donâ€™t use more than three action icons.
contentChunks.altText: 4 icons set to right of headline

contentChunks.htmlValue: Responsive layout

Mobile

On mobile breakpoints, the container occupies 100% of the screen width.

contentChunks.footer: A container uses 100% of the screen width on mobile breakpoints.
contentChunks.altText: Container taking entire screen width

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Tablet

On tablet breakpoints, the container occupies 100% of the screen width.

contentChunks.footer: The container occupies 100% of the screen width on tablet breakpoints.
contentChunks.altText: Container taking entire screen width

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Desktop

On desktop breakpoints, the top app bar container occupies 100% of the screen width.

contentChunks.footer: For desktop breakpoints, the top app bar container takes 100% of the screen width.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar expands to take total screen width

contentChunks.htmlValue: Behavior

Scrolling

Top app bars are positioned within the same space as content.

Only upon scrolling, the top app bar container fills with a contrasting color that provides visual separation from the background.

contentChunks.footer: Upon scrolling, a top app bar container fills with contrasting color to create a visual separation.
contentChunks.altText: Scrolling top app bar container fills with contrasting color

contentChunks.footer:
Upon scrolling, the top app bar can remain in place, or use a compress effect in which:
1. Scrolling upward hides the top app bar
2. Scrolling downward reveals the top app bar
contentChunks.altText: Scrolling top app bar compressing to scroll upwards or downward

contentChunks.footer: When scrolling up, Medium top app bars can use the compress effect to transform into Compact top app bars. They should not return to Medium size until the user scrolls back to the top of the page.
contentChunks.altText: Medium top app bar compresses to transform into Compact top app bar

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Nesting actions

When a screen is resized, the top app bar resizes with it. Actions are consolidated into the overflow menu.

contentChunks.footer: A resized screen has a resized top app bar, with actions consolidated into the overflow menu.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar resizing to wider width

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Responsiveness

The width of the top app bar container responds to the view or device width.

contentChunks.footer: A top app barâ€™s container responds to the view or device width.
contentChunks.altText: Top app bar resizing to wider view

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Accessibility guidelines coming soon

In progress: complete guidance for accessible interaction, keyboard navigation, labeling, and more. Learn more about accessibility.
